questions.question: Inheritance is:
options: a relationship between classes sharing variables
questions.hint: The subclass does not have access to the parent class' data

questions.question: What is a function?
questions.sampleAnswer: Named section of a program that performs a specific task
questions.hint: example of a function: increaseByOne(a) { return a+1 }

questions.question: Discuss the difference between methods, functions and procedures.
questions.sampleAnswer: In terms of ะก#/Java, function is the block of code, which return particular value, but procedure is the block of code which return void (nothing). In C#/Java both functions and procedures more often called just methods.

questions.question: What does OOP stand for?
questions.hint: It is the name of the module

questions.question: What is an object?
questions.sampleAnswer: It is an instance of a class.

questions.question: Write the code for a class Car with 2 attributes color and year. Then declare a new Object called youWish.
questions.sampleAnswer: public class Car { String brand = Porsche; color = dark blue; public static void main(String[] args) { Car youWish = new Car(); } }
questions.hint: You can declare the object in a main() function.

questions.question: What is procedural oriented programming?
questions.sampleAnswer: A series of instructions within a procedure, which are groups of commands, often called functions.

questions.question: How would you define functional programming?
questions.sampleAnswer: Functional programming is a programming paradigm, it
questions.hint: It is a programming paradigm, it is a way of thinking about software construction based on composing pure functions. Functional programming is based on mathematical functions. A pure function is a function which: Given the same inputs, always returns the same output, and has no side-effects. Function composition is the process of combining two or more functions in order to produce a new function or perform some computation. Functional programming languages are specially designed to handle symbolic computation and list processing applications.

questions.question: Procedural language contains systematic order of
What is a function in procedural programming
questions.sampleAnswer: A function in programming is a group of commands. Instead of only having one large block on instructions, functions allow developers to make smaller components, which makes it easier to understand.

questions.question: What is a computerised procedural system interpreted by?
questions.hint: Able to convert the entire program of the source code to machine language.

questions.question: Explain why we should use functional programming? And give one example.
questions.sampleAnswer: You should use functional programming if you want to represent certain logical facts and relationships and to have the computer calculate results. One example of using functional programming would be for artificial intelligence.
